text: Choi Tae-Uk (; born 13 March 1981) is a South Korean professional athlete. He is best known as an association football player. He was a member of the Korean national team.National-Football-Teams.com, "Choi Tae-Uk"; retrieved 2012-9-212. He was part of the Korean football team in the 2004 Summer Olympics at Athens.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Choi Tae-Uk" ; retrieved 2012-9-21. == Career statistics == === Club === Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League League League National cup National cup League cup League cup Continental Continental Total Total Club Season Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Anyang LG Cheetahs 2000 K League 12 1 2 0 4 0 2 0 20 1 2001 K League 26 0 1 0 5 0 2 1 34 1 2002 K League 22 2 0 0 0 0 2 0 24 2 2003 K League 36 3 1 0 — — 37 3 Total Total 96 6 4 0 9 0 6 1 115 7 Incheon United 2004 K League 23 5 0 0 0 0 — 23 5 Shimizu S-Pulse 2005 J1 League 25 5 4 1 8 3 — 37 9 Pohang Steelers 2006 K League 21 1 1 0 4 1 — 26 2 2007 K League 13 0 5 2 6 1 — 24 3 Total Total 34 1 6 2 10 2 — 50 5 Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors 2008 K League 18 4 2 0 8 0 — 28 4 2009 K League 28 9 2 0 4 0 — 34 9 2010 K League 12 2 0 0 3 0 6 1 21 3 Total Total 58 15 4 0 15 0 6 1 83 16 FC Seoul 2010 K League 16 6 0 0 0 0 — 16 6 2011 K League 13 0 1 0 0 0 2 1 16 1 2012 K League 28 2 1 0 0 0 — 29 2 2013 K League 1 10 0 2 0 — 4 0 16 0 Total Total 67 8 4 0 0 0 6 1 77 9 Ulsan Hyundai 2014 K League 1 1 0 0 0 — 2 0 3 0 Career total Career total Career total 304 40 22 3 42 5 19 3 388 51 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals South Korea 2000 4 2 South Korea 2001 6 1 South Korea 2002 10 1 South Korea 2003 5 0 South Korea 2005 2 0 South Korea 2009 2 0 South Korea 2012 1 0 Career total 30 4 :Results list South Korea's goal tally first.
